DOC.brief_summary: Research hypothesis : Does delay primary wound closure appendectomy adult complicate appendicitis reduce postoperative superficial surgical site infection compare primary wound closure . Study design : This study multicenter randomize control trial delay versus primary wound closure complicate appendicitis . Setting : Thammasat Hospital , Ramathibodi Hospital , Chonburi Hospital , Chonpratarn Hospital , Vachira Hospital , Pathumthani Hospital Participants : Adult patient age 18 year old non-pregnant woman diagnose gangrenous ruptured appendicitis . Outcome : Superficial surgical site infection Period study : August 2012 - August 2014
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Study Delayed Primary Closure Reduce Rate Wound Infection Complicated Appendicitis
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion 1 . Adult patient age 18 year old 2 . Have diagnose gangrenous rupture appendicitis base clinical criterion follow condition a.Gangrenous appendicitis i.Erythematous swell appendix ii.Appearance necrotic wall ( dark , grayish color ) b.Ruptured appendicitis i. Erythematous swell appendix ii.Appearance hole appendix iii.Rupture appendix procedure c.Appearance frank pus 3 . Nonimmunocompromised host include 1 . AIDS 2 . History endstage renal disease ( ESRD ) 3 . History autoimmune disease ( SLE ) 4 . Taking immunosuppressive agent ( e.g , steroid , Cyclophosphamide , Tacrolimus , Mycophenolate mofetil ) 5 . Cirrhosis ascites 6 . Morbid obesity ( BMI > 40 kg/m2 ) 4 . Nonpregnant woman 5 . Willing participate provide write informed consent
